channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #194 - The CPAN PR Challenge Now Has a Mini-Me!
item.description: Imitation, flattery, you know how the saying goes. Seems that our Neil tapped into something good, for the upcoming New York City Hackaton is going to have its own mini-CPAN PR Challenge -- which I find brilliant. In other news, Perl 5.22 is around the corner (yay!), and so is conference season. Hmmm... Which means I should probably begin to see what my Summer schedule should look like. And so should you, dear reader, so should you. ~ `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Perl Developer - Teleperformance - Grandview Heights, Ohio (Columbus)
item.description: Teleperformance is looking for talented Perl developers who are eager to join our team (10 developers).Â We are a close-knit development group who live and breathe Perl and the open source philosophy.Â We are located in Grandview Heights, Ohio, with easy access to the downtown area.

item.title: InsideSales.com - Pass our "Perl Challenge" & Win a $100 Amazon Gift Card
item.description: Our yummy Perl codebase handles millions of emails in production each week! We're growing like crazy, doubling in revenue and size annually. We want you to join our team in Utah. Pass our "Perl Challenge" to win a $100 Amazon gift card and an interview. Hires will receive a sizable signing bonus.

item.title: friendfeed.com/cpan is shut down
item.description: We can say "buh-bye", as the CPAN bot on FriendFeed has now officially booted its last bit.

item.title: Looking for HTML::FormFu patches and contributions
item.description: Dean took over the maintainership of HTML::FormFu. You or your team wish to see some new features or bug fixes worked on? Poke him.

item.title: Q&A with Larry Wall
item.description: There will be a Q&A session with Larry Wall at YAPC::NA 2015. Have a burning question you'd like to see him answer? Ricardo tells you how to submit it.

item.title: NYC Perl Hackathon 2015 has its own Mini CPAN PR Challenge
item.description: There will be a hackaton in New York city in May. Want to go but don't know on what to work? Don't worry: they'll have a mini-CPAN PR challenge just for that.

item.title: What's New on CPAN - March 2015
item.description: What landed on CPAN in March and seems interesting? David tells us.

item.title: A preview of Perl 5.22
item.description: Perl 5.22 is coming. What to know what the future has in reserves? brian offers us a sneak peek.

item.title: One Decade Down 01
item.description: Shadowcat Systems is 10 year old! If there was ever an occasion to raise a pint, this is it. Many happy returns, guys!

item.title: How Perl + StickK helped me get organized
item.description: David Mertens uses a punishment-and-reward system to get things done. Using the StickK website, he sets himself some goals. He manages to acheive them? A little more code enriches the Perl world. He fails? The site donates to the Perl Foundation using his credit card. Both ways, we win. I like that.

item.title: MX::AttributeShortcuts -- now with Moo-style type constraints
item.description: New release of the module that gives you more Moose for less boiler-plate. Now with 73% more constraints! And it's a good thing, I swear!

item.title: Happy easter, enjoy your unsigned types!
item.description: Unsightly? Never. But unsignly? From this week on.

item.title: Using Amazon SES and SNS from Perl.
item.description: Pretty much what it says on the tin.

item.title: CPAN great modules released last week
metacpan weekly report - Plack
stackoverflow perl report
Checking the whois record of many domains
item.description: This article uses Net::Whois::Raw for the task.

item.title: Replacing an accessor by a method (using BUILDARGS)
item.description: What happens if you have created an attribute in a class (e.g. 'age') and later you find out you shuld actually store the 'birthday'? How can you change your Moo-based class without breaking the code already using the 'age' attribute?

item.title: Analyzing Apache log file
item.description: The Apache log file is an excellent piece of raw data to teach various tasks in Perl. In this example we see the use of index and substr.

item.title: A Simple way to download many web pages using Perl
item.description: wget, curl, LWP::Simple, HTTP::Tiny. Pick your favorite solution.
